page.title: 16How the Land is Used
page.content: The area we looked at was mostly agricultural land. Most of the buildings were farms which were made out of granite. Most of the crops were potatoes also I saw some cabbages, courgettes, carrots, beans and tomatoes. I saw only one apple orchard. Most of the fields were crops, sown grass or rough pasture. Some of the rough pasture was used for grazing and I saw quite a lot of cows and a few horses. The area that I visited was called Les Augres and it was in Trinity. There were quite a few private houses and they all had gardens, some had vegetables growing in them as well as flowers. Some people were selling their vegetables on stalls by their gates. I also saw at least two shops, one of them sold tyres.
